question: Who was Nephi’s nephew that wrote the third book in the Book of Mormon?
It came to pass that Enos knew that his father was a_____ man.
Was a prophet of the Lord and also the father of Enos?
How many chapters are in the book of Enos?
Enos was not taught in the language of his father, therefore he made up his own.
Who taught Enos of the nurture and admonition of the Lord?
And I will tell you of the_____ which I had before God, before I received a remission of my sins.
The word wrestle is only mentioned once in the Book of Mormon.
Enos went to hunt_____ in the forest.
Enos’s father spoke to him concerning eternal_____, and the joy of the saints, and those words sank deep into his heart.
And my soul hungered; and I kneeled down before my_____.
Enos cried unto his Maker in mighty prayer and supplication for his own soul.
Enos cried unto his Maker all day long, and when the night came, he raised his voice high that it reached the_____.
Who said: “Enos, thy sins are forgiven thee, and thou shalt be blessed”
And I, _____, knew that God could not lie; wherefore, my guilt was swept away.
Enos asked the Lord how it was done that his sins were forgiven.
How was Enos’ guilt for his sins forgiven?
The Lord told Enos that two years would pass away before Christ would manifest himself in the flesh.
The Lord told Enos that his faith alone did not make him whole.
When Enos heard the words of the Lord he began to feel a desire, for the welfare of his brethren, the_____.
Enos poured out his whole soul unto God, for the welfare of the Nephites.
Enos struggled in the spirit while he was praying for the welfare of the Nephites.
The Lord told Enos that he would visit his brethren according to their_____ in keeping his commandment.
Enos was told by the Holy Ghost that the land of promise was a holy land.
The Lord told Enos that he would curse the land of promise save it be for the cause of_____.
Their transgressions will I bring down with sorrow upon their own_____.
After Enos heard the words of the Lord, his faith began to be unshaken in the Lord.
Enos prayed unto the Lord with many long struggles, for his brethren, the_____.
Enos prayed and labored with all his diligence unto the Lord.
The Lord said unto Enos that he would grant his desires because of his_____.
Enos desired of the Lord: That if the Nephites should fall because of transgression and the Lamanites should not be destroyed, that he would preserve the record of his people.
Enos desired that the record of his people be brought forth at some future day unto the_____; that they may be brought forth unto salvation.
For at the present our struggles were vain in restoring Lamanites to the true_____.
The Lamanites swore in their wrath that if it were possible, they would destroy the Nephites and their records, and also all the_____ of their fathers.
Enos cried unto the Lord continually because he knew that he would preserve their records.
The Lord said to Enos:  “Whatsoever thing ye shall ask in_____, believing that ye shall receive in the name of Christ, ye shall receive it”.
Because Enos had faith in the Lord; he knew that whatsoever he asked of him, he would receive it.
The Lord_____ with Enos that he would bring forth his records unto the Lamanites in his own due time.
Enos said that the Lord would bring forth his records unto the Lamanites when he would still be alive.
Enos knew that the Lord would do with the records that which he had covenanted with him; wherefore his soul did_____.
The Lord compared Enos’ faith like that of his_____.
Enos went about among the people of Nephi, _____ of things to come.
Enos testified to the Nephites of the things which he had heard and seen.
And I Enos, _____ record that the people of Nephi did seek diligently to restore the Lamanites unto the true faith of God.
Enos and his brothers’ labors were in vain because the Lamanites hatred was fixed, and they were led by their evil nature.
Because of their evil nature, the Lamanites became a wild, ferocious, and____ people.
According to Enos, the Lamanites were full of idolatry and filth1ness; feeding upon beast’s of_____, and dwelling in tents.
The Lamanites would wander in the wilderness with a short skin girdle about their loins and their_____ shaven.
The Lamanites skill was not in the bow, and in the cimeter, and the ax.
Many of the Lamanites did eat nothing but_____ meat; continually seeking to destroy the Nephites.
In his book Enos, he describes the way of life in the Nephite culture and also of the Lamanites.
The people of Nephi did not till the ground but raised cattle instead.
The Nephites did till the land, and raised all kinds of grain, and fruit, and flocks of herds.
The Nephites raised_____ of all manner of cattle of every kind, and goats, and wild goats.
During the time that Enos was on the earth the Nephites did not have horses.
Enos said that there were many prophets in the land among them but that the people were a_____ people, hard to understand.
Enos said that there was exceeding harshness, preaching and prophesying of_____, and contentions and destructions.
Because of the exceeding harshness, preaching and prophesying of wars, the people were continually reminded of death.
The people were continually reminded of the judgments and _____ of God.
Because of the exceeding great plainness of speech, it would keep the people from going down speedily to destruction.
Enos did not see many wars between the Nephites and Lamanites in the course of his days.
Enos was wrought upon the power of God that he must preach and prophesy unto the people and declare the word according to the truth which is in_____.
Enos declared in all his days to the truth which is in Christ, and rejoiced in it above that of the world.
Enos said that he knew that he would go to the place of his rest, which is with his Redeemer; and knew that in him he would rest.
Enos rejoiced in the day that his mortal shall put on_____; and shall stand before him; and would see his face with pleasure.
Enos said that the Lord would say to him:  “Come unto me, ye blessed, there is a place prepared for you in the_____, of my Father”.
